title: Projects and sidenotes
text:
Paperplanes  
I am a co(n)founder of this small beauty-spreading project. 
Paperplanes is a social media channel sharing hidden, beautiful contents, each matched with an open question.
It helped me improve project management and team building skills, as well as the ability to fit creativity into deadlines.



Jodie  
Music is my way to blow off steam.
I enjoy both listening and playing. I used to write only for myself, but eventually I started working on my first release. It will be out next autumn under the name Jodie.  
Probably the happiest project of my life so far!

title: Data-viz projects
text:
A one-year long talk
December 2022
Outline: sometimes, it is fun to look back when the end comes. A one-year-long talk is a short ride in the longest WhatsApp talk I had over the 2022. 
Tools: Python (cleaning, wrangling), R (visualization). 
Source code  















 


FIFA World Cups
July 2022
Outline: first D3 project. An exploration of participants and storylines of FIFA World Cups over the history. 
Tools: Observable, D3. 
Source code  


 


#tidytuesday
March-April 2022
Outline: some submissions to Tidy Tuesday - project providing a safe and supportive forum for individuals to practice their wrangling and data visualization skills in th R ecosystem. 
Tools: R. 
Source code

title: Giorgia Ditano
text:
Hello, this is Giorgia.
I am a research fellow (statistician) at University of Bologna (Italy).
I am a methodic and thoughtful person: precision and committment are my assets.  
I firmly believe in the power of data to draw a reliable map for any creation process.

title: Curriculum Vitae
text:
University of Bologna - DIMEC / Bologna, Italy
September 2021 - Present
Statistician for the EU-funded research project ORCHESTRA, designed to establish an international large-scale cohort to use as ground of research to improve the prevention and treatment of COVID-19.  
[Area of competence: WP5, healthcare workers cohort.]

title: Curriculum Vitae
text:

title: Curriculum Vitae
text:
Education  

MSc Statistical Sciences (curriculum: Data Science)
University of Bologna / Bologna, Italy
September 2018 - March 2021
Graduated with 110 / 110 cum laude
Dissertation in Natural Language Processing: “Variational Sequence Labeling for Part-of-Speech tagging: a BERT-based approach” 
Increased experience with deep learning models (VAEs, DNNs), language models (BERT) and Python coding.


Erasmus+ Study semester
Københavns Universitet / Copenhagen, Denmark
January 2020 - July 2020
Gained experience with ML and programming, Copenhagen, Denmark improved (weekly) deadlines management.


BSc Economics and Management
University of Trento / Trento, Italy
September 2015 - July 2018
Graduated with 110 / 110 cum laude
Dissertation (language: IT) in Inference and Probability: “Pilot statistical study on the perception of the immigration phenomenon in the municipality of Trento”

title: Curriculum Vitae
text:
Computer skills  







Programming
Else




Data analysis and statistical modeling with STATA.
Data wrangling and visualization in R (Tidyverse).
Scientific computing and machine learning fundamentals in Python (Numpy, Scikit-Learn, PyTorch).
Basics of web native data visualizations with D3 and Observable.
Academic foundations of SQL and C++.
Git / GitHub.
Collaborative work with Slack and Trello.
Reporting with Quarto.
OS: MacOS, Windows, Linux (basics).

title: Curriculum Vitae
text:
Publications  
Sansone, Emanuele et al. (2023). The Effect of the Immunization Schedule and Antibody Levels (Anti-S) on the Risk of SARS-CoV-2 Infection in a Large Cohort of Healthcare Workers in Northern Italy. Vaccines, 11, 4, 746.
Collatuzzo, Giulia et al. (2023). Temporal trends of COVID-19 antibodies in vaccinated healthcare workers undergoing repeated serological sampling: An individual-level analysis within 13 months in the ORCHESTRA cohort. Frontiers in immunology, 13, 1079884.
Collatuzzo, Giulia et al. (2022). Determinants of Anti-S Immune Response at 9 Months after COVID-19 Vaccination in a Multicentric European Cohort of Healthcare Workers-ORCHESTRA Project. Viruses, 14, 12 2657.
Collatuzzo, Giulia et al. (2022). Effectiveness of prevention of SARS-CoV-2 transmission among unvaccinated Italian healthcare workers. La Medicina Del Lavoro, 113, 6.
Collatuzzo, Giulia et al. (2022). Determinants of anti-S immune response at 6 months after COVID-19 vaccination in a multicentric European cohort of healthcare workers - ORCHESTRA project. Frontiers in immunology, 13, 986085.
Porru, Stefano et al. (2022). SARS-CoV-2 Breakthrough Infections: Incidence and Risk Factors in a Large European Multicentric Cohort of Health Workers. Vaccines, 10(8), 1193.
